intro: Parathesis venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan parathesis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It is often found in humid, shaded areas of the forest understory. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
